title: Horacio Pacheco
text:
Horacio Pacheco (born 5 May 1983) is a Bolivian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a>.
Career.
Pacheco was born in <a href="Tarija">Tarija</a>. After beginning his career as a fitness coach, he began his managerial career in 2014, with . He took the club to the semifinals of the <a href="Copa%20Sim%C3%B3n%20Bol%C3%ADvar">Copa Simón Bolívar</a> in the 2015–16 campaign, and was subsequently appointed in charge of <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Cicl%C3%B3n">Ciclón</a> in July 2016.
Pacheco resigned from Ciclón on 24 February 2017, and took over <a href="Avil%C3%A9s%20Industrial%20F.C.">Avilés Industrial</a> for the 2018 campaign. With the latter club he reached the finals of the Simón Bolívar, but lost it to <a href="Club%20Always%20Ready">Always Ready</a>, and subsequently missed out promotion after losing the play-offs to <a href="Club%20Destroyers">Destroyers</a>.
In February 2019, Pacheco was named in charge of <a href="C.D.%20Real%20Tomayapo">Real Tomayapo</a>, and won the second division with the club in 2020. On 6 January 2021, he renewed his contract for a further year for the club's debut in the <a href="Bolivian%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Primera División</a>.
Honours.
Real Tomayapo
